main.name: JooYong Daniel Chung
main.description: I am currently looking for a Patent Engineering or Data Scientist position at a forward moving company.
main.bio: I am passionate in collecting, analyzing, and investigating new datasets, developing graphical models, and performing data management skills. I also love learning about new technologies and understanding new patents. I hope to go to law school someday and become a Patent Lawyer.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I love learning new things and exploring around new languages

education.degree: Bachelors in Science in Computer Engineering
education.minor: Minor in Computational Science and Engineering
education.detail_2: IEEE Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) Honors Society
education.detail_3: Sargent and Lundy Engineering Scholarship, Recipient

education.college_1: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
education.detail_2: Jules D. Falzer Memorial Scholarship, Recipient

work.title: Intern
work.detail_1: Analyzed the ongoing patent work with the firm’s patent attorney to discuss problems presented in the claim sets relating that of a biosensor at an introductory level and reviewed patents that were already filed
work.detail_2: Cultivated an understanding of emerging technological trend and researched on computation of damages and reasonable royalties related to patent infringement

work.title: Intern
work.detail_1: Analyzed the newly redesigned amplifier circuits for Evolved SeaSparrow Missile (ESSM) to identify any potential mistakes in the design and created general block diagrams for different technical design reviews accordingly
work.detail_2: Developed multiple reuse design blocks that would reduce the cycle time of building new circuits, prevent the duplication of work from multiple engineers, and accelerate the simulation time of different circuit software

work.title: Resident Advisor
work.detail_1: Provided academic counseling, career advice, and help with personal conflicts to the residents by holding consistent, weekly conversations, resulting in none of the residents to be held on to academic probation
work.detail_2: Recruited new housing staff with the Resident Director by conducting a series of behavior interviews, assessing their interpersonal communication skills, conflict management skills, and positivity to see their fit in the hall community

work.title: Student Technician
work.detail_1: Renovated and repaired technical equipments required in different laboratories to improve efficiencies within classroom settings and research projects
work.detail_2: Trained technical skills to new hires to help them transition from the academic background in ECE to a professional environment

activities.title: Co-Chair
activities.detail_1: Consulted with the ECE administration staff and professors on behalf of ECE student body regarding student development in technical curriculum courses and general concerns of students regarding the department and classes
activities.detail_2: Established overall committee agenda and administered all student-led ECE department events such as student advising sessions, consulting sessions technical elective classes, and hosting resume review sessions

activities.title: President
activities.detail_1: Oversaw the planning of weekly new engineering projects for the elementary students that would enhance their critical thinking, STEM interest, and teamwork skills through hands on experience in solving real world challenges
activities.detail_2: Identified and coordinated volunteering meetings with the staff of the elementary schools and sponsors to facilitate club growth and bring more opportunities to the volunteers, leading to increase in 30% membership

activities.title: Vice President
activities.detail_1: Researched various companies’ internship programs to inform freshmen engineers on the real life expectations of the employers from their interns
activities.detail_2: Illustrated the possibilities of internship to freshmen who are often discouraged by the companies in career fair by hosting talks on applications and referring to different school resources

projects.title: Covid-19 UIUC Resource App
projects.category: Created a convenient webpage that provides information about resources on Covid-19 for UIUC Students

projects.title: Chicago Food Vendor Data Analysis
projects.category: Analyzed and investigated the different safety levels of various food vendors in Chicago

projects.title: Data Analysis
projects.category: Analyzed numerous datasets using PPDAC Cycle. Stored in Github

projects.title: C++ Projects
projects.category: Contains various small projects, such as PhotoMosaic generator and random maze generator/solutions

projects.title: Python Projects
projects.category: Various small projects using python, such as finding shortest path and determining machine to find positive movie reviews, have been implmented using AI techniques

projects.title: Image Classifier
projects.category: By using AWS and CUDA GPU Programming, this project had been created to find the best optimization for image detection to decrease the computing time
